page.title: 01FINDON VILLAGE
page.content: Findon is a small, nuclear settlement situated in a valley below Cissbury Ring on the South Downs. Development and Communications have been restricted because of the location. The village commands excellent Downland views. Findon is a quiet, peaceful, attractive and unspoilt village. As a result it is a popular location for people to retire to. The buildings consist of older buildings mostly of flint and brick with slate roofs clustering around the 17th Century Inn in the village centre, with more modern buildings radiating out to the periphery of the village. Findon has retained its rural atmosphere preserving its small friendly shopping centre and sense of community. There is a village school and there are many clubs and organisations for all age groups.
